pk.contender.earmouse

Class ExerciseFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • Fragment
      • pk.contender.earmouse.ExerciseFragment

  • public class ExerciseFragment
extends Fragment
    Implements a selected Module by presenting the user with random exercises from said Module and processing the answers.
    Author:
    Paul Klinkenberg

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int currentExercise
      The index of the Exercise in mod that we are currently doing.
      private static int EXERCISE_CONTINUE
      State in which an exercise has been correctly answered and a click on the ButtonGrid or Play button will load the next exercise.
      private static int EXERCISE_READY
      State in which an exercise is prepared and has been played at least once, the buttons in the ButtonGrid are enabled.
      private static int EXERCISE_READY_NOTPLAYED
      State in which an exercise is prepared but has not been played, the buttons in the ButtonGrid are disabled as we do not want the user to (inadvertently) give an answer before listening to the exercise.

      The current state.

    • Field Detail

      • EXERCISE_READY

        private static final int EXERCISE_READY
        State in which an exercise is prepared and has been played at least once, the buttons in the ButtonGrid are enabled. Exercise can be played as often as the user wants.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • EXERCISE_CONTINUE

        private static final int EXERCISE_CONTINUE
        State in which an exercise has been correctly answered and a click on the ButtonGrid or Play button will load the next exercise. Clicking on the Play button will, in addition to preparing the next exercise, also play the media as soon as it is available.
        See Also:
        MediaFragment.requestPlayback(), Constant Field Values

      • EXERCISE_READY_NOTPLAYED

        private static final int EXERCISE_READY_NOTPLAYED
        State in which an exercise is prepared but has not been played, the buttons in the ButtonGrid are disabled as we do not want the user to (inadvertently) give an answer before listening to the exercise.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        private static final java.lang.String PREFERENCES_ISEMPTY

      • onCreateView

        public View onCreateView(LayoutInflater inflater,
                ViewGroup container,
                Bundle savedInstanceState)

      • onActivityCreated

        public void onActivityCreated(Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Initializes or restores the Fragment's state. If the parent activity was started from an android.content.Intent, set up the UI from the given position value, otherwise restore the state the fragment was left in.

      • setEmpty

        void setEmpty()
        Hide the main UI of the fragment and display a single TextView instead. Used on tablets when there is no Module selected, instead of showing an empty layout we show this TextView saying 'No Module Selected'

      • setNotEmpty

        void setNotEmpty()
        Unhide the main UI, does the exact opposite of setEmpty().

      • setModule

        public void setModule(int position)
        Display the Module at position in Main.getModuleList()

        If position is out of bounds set the UI to 'empty', otherwise load the selected Module, set up the UI and prepare an exercise.

        Parameters:
        position - The position of the Module in Main.getModuleList() to display

      • getModuleIndex

        public int getModuleIndex()

      • onPause

        public void onPause()
        Save complete state.

      • onResume

        public void onResume()

      • prepareExercise

        private void prepareExercise()
        Prepare an exercise for this activity.

        This function will receive an Exercise index from the loaded Module and use that to:
        - Set up the ButtonGrid with the answers
        - Start the MediaFragment to prepare and load the required WAV file
        - Set up the FeedbackBarFragment to reflect the current state.

      • onClickPlay

        public void onClickPlay(View view)
        On receiving a click event on the Play button, relay it to the MediaFragment and: If the current state is EXERCISE_READY_NOTPLAYED, move the state to EXERCISE_READY If the current state is EXERCISE_CONTINUE, prepare an exercise and request the MediaFragment to play it as soon as it is ready, and set the state to EXERCISE_READY
        Parameters:
        view - The parent view where the click event was received.

      • onAnswerSelected

        public void onAnswerSelected(int position)
        Handler for click events in the ButtonGridFragment

        Depending on the state of the Activity, handle user input, see code for details.

        Parameters:
        position - The position of the Button in the ButtonGridFragment that was clicked.

      • setFeedbackText

        private void setFeedbackText(java.lang.String text)
        Set the feedback text in FeedbackBarFragment
        Parameters:
        text - The text to set in the FeedbackBarFragment text field.

      • updateFeedbackStatistics

        public void updateFeedbackStatistics()
        Update FeedbackBarFragment statistics

      • fadeButton

        private void fadeButton(int position)
        Fade out the Button in ButtonGridFragment at the given position
        Parameters:
        position - The position of the Button in ButtonGridFragment to fade out.
